content.heading: HTML <picture> Element
paragraphs: The HTML <picture> element allows you to display different images based on the device or screen size.

content.heading: Why Use <picture>?
paragraphs: The <picture> element gives web developers more flexibility when specifying image sources. It can contain multiple <source> elements, each pointing to different images via the srcset attribute.
The browser chooses the image that best fits the current screen size or device based on the media attribute of each <source>.

content.heading: Use Case: Bandwidth Optimization
paragraphs: Using <picture> allows small devices to load smaller image files, saving bandwidth. The browser loads the first <source> that matches the current device conditions and skips the rest.

content.heading: Use Case: Format Support
paragraphs: Some devices or browsers may not support all image formats. The <picture> element allows you to specify multiple formats, and the browser will use the first supported format.
